website_summaries.verdict: Quality headphones ideal for studio and monitoring use. The 9.8-foot cable allows plenty of room to move about.
pros: We love the retro vibe of these headphones
The closed-ear design is good for shutting out exterior sounds
Comfortable to wear with padded cups and headband
Features a wide frequency response of 10 hertz to 20 kilohertz
cons: Some buyers think the plastic components are too flimsy

website_summaries.verdict: While these headphones are pricey, they have awesome sound quality.
pros: Comfortable for long-term use, they collapse for portability and have been known to last years and years
cons: The sound quality is lacking a little bass

website_summaries.verdict: They've been around since 1991, but the Sony MDR-7506s are still great sounding -- and fitting -- headphones for less than $100.
pros: Sony's MDR-7506 closed-back, full-size headphones click with all music genres and are comfortable to wear for hours at a time
They sound excellent for their relatively modest price point
cons: With a coiled, pro-style cable and lack of an inline remote/microphone, some will find the 7506s less mobile-friendly than more modern headphones

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quality All Around
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why these are advertised as professional grade, because they are anything but. They feel like the computer lab headphones I used as a kid in the 90s. They do not fit over the ears unless you have very small ears, they are also not deep enough for an over-ear headphone. I found them to be stiff and uncomfortable. The heaviest part of the headphones are the cord. I'd shop around for something better if you're interested in comfort. I regret purchasing these headphones and have requested a refund.
customer_reviews.author: tpersohn

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be
customer_reviews.text: My last version of these headphones lasted a decade doing production all over the world. This version lasted 120 days and now are broken - 30 days after warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Great audio quality, horrible mechanicals
customer_reviews.text: The audio range on these headphones are absolutely stellar, but the cord is the biggest annoyance I've ever dealt with. It's heavy, bulky, pulls down on the headphones, and gets in the damn way all the time. I shake my leg a lot when I'm sitting in a chair, and the cord moving around makes the headphones quite noisy - meaning the movement in the cord causes mechanical movement vibration noises in the headphones which annoy the hell out of me; I have to hold the cord to dampen the vibration to remove the noise. These headphones would be 1000x more awesome with a removable cord.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Diaz

customer_reviews.title: The BEST, unless you crank them up
customer_reviews.text: These are the BEST cans, ever, for me. HOWEVER if you like to crank up the volume till your ears bleed.....then do not buy these, they loose way too much at very high volume. HOWEVER #2..... if you want the Best sounding cans at low, medium or medium loud volume, don't hesitate, these are the BEST you will find under 2k. I have been a serious student of rock and roll for 46 years, and listening to music with these cans, I have heard noanses in works from Elton, jethro Chicago, etc that I have never heard before. Just don't crank them up too high
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with right channel blown
customer_reviews.text: Something was wrong with these from the start. The right channel was lower than the left no matter what I played. Then after about 2 hours of total use it started buzzing on the right side to the point where it couldn't even be listened to. It could be a manufacturing defect, or it may have been damaged in shipping. Amazon sent these $90 headphones in a padded envelope and not a box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really Sony?
customer_reviews.text: After a few tries with low-priced earbuds, and after owning an excellent set of beats by Dre earbuds that are now failing, I figured I'de go for the professional sound. I was SURE to get full sound and bass with professional headphones...........NOT...........honestly, they sound no better than the tin-sounding headphones that I've wasted money on up to this point. I compared them with the Betron B25 noise canceling headphones that cost $13.99, and there was no comparison. Try it yourself and see. Sony should be ashamed of themselves for being in the business for so long and putting out such horrible sounding product.
customer_reviews.author: Tony from Landover, MD

customer_reviews.title: Way better than anything else in this price range
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. They are so much better than the Beats crap and other trendy brands people go so crazy over. Whether you are using them plugged into your mixing console for live sound/recording or you just plug them into your phone, the sound is fantastic. The frequency response is flat and accurate, so you get what you are supposed to without any overly exaggerated frequencies, The bass is solid and accurate without being overpowering, The mids are clear and the highs are clean.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Buy these!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my son to use on his keyboard. He couldn’t believe all the details he could hear for the first time. He has tried Bose and Beats while he says they work fine, he believes these are far better for composing music because it allows him to have a better balance of highs, lows and mid tones. For the price, you can’t go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff mikels

customer_reviews.title: These are the best headphones money can buy
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are built like a tank, and can withstand years of abuse. Replacement parts are available and servicing them is easy. The construction is simple, too, and fixes as simple as replacing the pads can be done in minutes. There are two downsides to these headphones: * The cable is not removable. * There is no bluetooth/wireless. Both of these can be fixed with modifications, and there are plenty of guides online on how to do this. RE noise cancelling; this is probably not even necessary, the seal around your ears is pretty great, while staying comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Philihp Busby

customer_reviews.title: Easily The Best For Its Price
customer_reviews.text: This is now the second pair of these I've bought. I bought my first set in 2008 when I was enrolled at Berklee in Studio Production. This was the recommendation of the instructor and they lasted me through the entire curriculum and then I pretty much mixed and mastered an entire album with them. Since then they have been my home studio workhorse. Incredibly accurate and balanced frequency response. Truly indispensable. This latest purchase was my second pair since the old ones finally started to wear down a bit. I'm actually thinking of buying another pair, just for back-up.
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Brodeur

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but returned nonetheless! What?
customer_reviews.text: Short and sweet: These felt cheap but for the price I’m not really gonna complain as I expected as much. However, my biggest issue with them was that you couldn’t detach the really long wire from the headphones. Now this is not to say I had any issue with the wires at all, as I expected as much. But in the GLORIOUS age of tech, these things should be interchangeable already. What can I say, I was spoiled by wireless V-moda’s so...yep. Besides the cord on this thing being so long, imagine if you damaged it accidentally you’d be screwed. Sound quality was EXCELLENT but the cord not being interchangeable was the deal breaker. Edited to correct typos :).
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Great cans for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have several headphones, AKG, Sennheiser, AudioTechnica, etc. These are my first Sony's, and they sound great. The other recommended brand is Sennheiser 280s, but I think these sound more natural and similar to higher end headphones (like my AKGs).
customer_reviews.author: E. Dannewitz

customer_reviews.title: Standard for Studio Headphones for Performers
customer_reviews.text: Excellent standard studio or at-home listening headphones. The review asks for a rating on noise cancellation which is weird and totally beside the point of that these cans do. They don’t really isolate and definitely don’t cancel noice but that’s not what they’re made to do. These are for use in a studio where the performer needs to hear reference tracks clearly but the mics in the room don’t. They’re great at that... though the loudest sound levels in the headphones will still be picked up by the most sensitive mics and compressors. They’re not good for final mixing, but you should be doing that in a full mid-field monitor setup anyway.
customer_reviews.author: ASmith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many headphones over the years, and currently have 2 GradoSR60, Sr225s, a Skullcandy, a Sony EBB and variety of earbuds. These Sony MDR7506 are my go-to cans for stereo or tv listening when I want to be quiet and yet enjoy high quality sound. Perfect for magical sound from tv DVD concerts. Great bass, mid, and treble tones. And great value, half the price of similar quality. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: SteveTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Love these old 'phones!
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of these back in the eighties. Never thought I'd find another pair as good for a decent price, until I found the originals still for sale. At under $80 you really can't go wrong, and there's a reason studios bought them by the case. The sound is perhaps not for those who love their base deep. But for those who want an accurate portrayal of their music, these are the cans for you.
customer_reviews.author: Limey Smokejumper

customer_reviews.title: Audiophiles
customer_reviews.text: If you are an audiophile this headset is for you. The sound quality is very high and no distortion. It's been highly rated online elsewhere as well. I have owned this for about a year now and i'm still amazed with how crystal clear and crisp the sound quality is. There's so many options in the market today, but for the price, this is very likely to be your best bet. I hope this review was helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Mainecoon Cat

customer_reviews.title: High quality headphones at an excellent price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these headphones for over two years now. Sound quality is excellent and very balanced, not like Beats that are tuned to be very bass-heavy. Nice, long, heavy-duty coiled cable. They are built to last but if something does fail you can completely disassemble them and find replacement parts for every piece which is very nice. This is an old school feature you don't see much anymore. I replaced the earpads after about a year as the vinyl was starting to flake off but haven't had a single issue with them beyond that. Highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Heath Adams

customer_reviews.title: Not enough high end
customer_reviews.text: My Beyerdynamic DT990PRO ($179) and Samson SR850 ($40) have significantly wider frequency spectrum than these Sony’ MDR7506. These headphones miss a lot of crystal clarity, and are probably only best for tracking (listening live while recording audio). I would’ve kept these but I have some $20 Tascam’s that work just as well in the studio booth. In 2020 these are obsolete for any sort of meticulous editing in the studio. Side note, I’ve been mulling on returning DT990PRO for about 2 weeks since I wasn’t a fan of their High hi’s and high low frequency. With these Sony’s it took me only 10 minutes to decide.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sony MDR-7506 HEADPHONES
customer_reviews.text: Aloha from Hawaii. This Sony headphones arrived today (5-28-2020), and I tried it for the 1st time. Well, let me tell you that these are a superb set of headphones period!! I could hear sounds way in the background that I couldn't hear with my older, cheaper Sony headphones. Sound quality was great!! bass was not over whelming, treble was very good. Like I've said before, I could hear sounds that I didn't realize were there. Wife tried it and she loved it so much (commandeered) my new headphones , so I ordered another set for me. Thank you very much for such a fine listening device !!. Sincerely, Mike.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Industry standards for a reason
customer_reviews.text: Chances are of you are buying these you already know what they are. If you don't, they are high quality industry standards for a reason. Comfortable, accurate sounding, affordable. If you are looking for bass monster cans, these are not them. They do however provide solid bass without any exaggerated boost. You can spend more on reference headphones but you don't have to.
customer_reviews.author: Shiloh

customer_reviews.title: Would buy 'em again in a heartbeat
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones because of my dissatisfaction with another brand / model that I intended to use while recording. These Sony 'phones have everything I need: long springey cord, excellent neutral sound with clarity, tension on the earcups that's not too tight (which was my big complaint with the other brand of headphones; they're real clampers), comfortable replaceable pads on the earcups, and fold-up for neat storage. I'm really glad I got these Sony MDR7506 'phones.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Bendable ear attachments, blue-light glasses fit outside, good sound, and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: First of all, open-back headphones are the best (I use beyerdynamics) because they have the best sound quality and you don't muddy bass when you talk. However, open backs don't reduce external noises very much (refrigerator, gaming pc fans, etc) I'm pretty sure these are the best closed back headphones, ESPECIALLY for this price.. my favorite aspects are that you can bend the ears to fit "loosely" but they'll block less noise. You can fit blue-light blocking glasses outside of the headphones, as opposed to having the headphone press them into your head.
customer_reviews.author: neaumusic

customer_reviews.title: Good head phones
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews for this head set and felt like it would be a good purchase. I've owned them for about a month now and haven't been disappointed. They sound great. Pros: great sound; I can hear things in songs I've never heard before; clarity is fantastic; as many other reviewers have said, offers a flat sound with no one range overpowering the other; Cons: not as comfortable as beats or other similar headphones; can get a little warm; cord isn't ideal; For the money and the level of sound, I honestly think this compare with some of the higher end headphones. I would recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: J. Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding headphones.
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to find really good headphones at a decent price these days, but these really do deliver. Great fidelity, very comfortable to wear, and has a nice long cord including a 1/4 adapter if you need one. With older ears, I really appreciate the mid range of these, without them having too much base at the low end. I plan to buy a second pair for another application in our home.
customer_reviews.author: WaywardSand

customer_reviews.title: Famous for a reason, because they are great!
customer_reviews.text: I love them, they sounds great and very comfortable! I have Sennheiser HD600, Beyer dynamic DT990, AudioTechinica M50X, Philips SHP9500, Hifiman He400s, Shure 1540. But I enjoy wearing these most of the time, great clean sound with emotion and realistic playback. They are not perfect, first the cable is not detachable. so you need to carry the super long ,heavy cable with you everywhere. Secondly the closed back design determine they won't have the sound stage like the other open back design headphone. Overall this is a great headphone for all kind of music because of the neutral sound signature. If you like a bigger sound stage and use headphone at home, get the Philips SHP9500.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: Since these headphones replaced ancient Radio Shack phones, I did not know how much better the technology had gotten. Sony advertises the frequency response as 10Hz to 20khz; although I doubt these numbers, there is no doubt they are very good. Using an internet ear test I was able to discern from 20 Hz to 8400 hz (OK, I am retired). Music and voices are remarkably clear. Bass, midrange and high frequency were equally pleasing. The earcups are comfortable, at least for the 1/2 hour time frames that I have utilized them. It comes with 2 gold-plated plugs that will fit about any normal source. Assuming they last, thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: F. E.

customer_reviews.title: Noise Leakage after a year
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what happened, but loved my headphones. Now after a year noise leakage is awful. My engineer informed me that my mic picked up on my headphones music while recording. Mind you, we tried everything by turning down the headphones and more. I think I may have gotten a bad pair. Very disappointing. I don’t know if I should buy another pair or just move on.
customer_reviews.author: ]A__

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Audio stopped consistently coming through both sides shortly after the warranty expired and I would have to fiddle with the cord to get it to come through both ears. Now 6 months after purchasing I can't even get it to come through the right ear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice cans for the price
customer_reviews.text: so these are well-reviewed and well-loved. i finally gave them a try. they don't leak that much noise. the sound is generally full, but not as true as my etymotics, which are much more accurate. as you can see on websites that tracked relative dB reproduction on these headphones, the bass and mids are slightly amplified, not to say that they're muddy, but they produce a bit more sound stage, which changes the overall atmosphere of music as you might hear it. they're comfortable, and not super noticeable after a couple hours of wear. we'll see if the breaking in helps with the overall quality but for now, they're pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: annie w.

customer_reviews.title: What the pro's use
customer_reviews.text: Greetings, I am an audio engineer with more than a hundred commercially available products. I can tell you for a fact that these are the most popular studio headphones. I'd rather pay for these than have any other pair for free. These are simply the best.
customer_reviews.author: Robert V. Wainscott

customer_reviews.title: I started playing bass guitar and needed some good phones so as to not disturb my neighbors at ...
customer_reviews.text: I wore through a pair of these that I had from college (25 years ago, gulp), but didn't replace them because I had no need. Recently, I started playing bass guitar and needed some good phones so as to not disturb my neighbors at night. I made the mistake of trying the Phil Jones Bass Guitar Headphones H850s for $99. I thought they were super weak. So, I picked-up these Sony's for a little comparison, and the Sony's blew the H850s out of the water. I'll never get another kind of headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Awakening

customer_reviews.title: A replacement of my old ATH M50x
customer_reviews.text: My ATH m50x just broke so I have to find a replacement and end-up with this MDR7506. I would said this one suit my like much better than m50x, it does have much clear mid and treble. Only problem is the bass, that's not as good as m50x. The second pros is the weight and clamps strength, while m50x always cause my pinna a pain, this one does not. The third pros is the price, nearly half of m50x. Happy purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Supharerk Thawillarp

customer_reviews.title: Very Good For the Money
customer_reviews.text: I like these headphones well. As I'm using them to edit interviews and such I don't know, or really care, what an audiophile would think of them. They aren't high-end quality, I'm sure, but for editing podcasts as an example, they work well. These headphones are reasonably comfortable. Though I wouldn't describe them as isolating, I'm able to do the work with the ordinary sounds in my environment, such as telephones, conversation and microwave noises. There's a long coiled cord but it's weight is manageable. The earpieces are comfortable and I've found that these headphones can be worn for hours without discomfort. For the price, they're a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Nice headphones until one side stopped working
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable. I thought I would invest in a decent set after having cheap uncomfortable ones for a long time. But, after 12 months one side stopped working. I never play anything very loud so must have been a fluke. Anyway, 2 stars for the duration they lasted, 5 stars for sound and comfort. If I felt I did something to blow the speaker I wouldn't drop the rating, but I really don't think it was the user in this case.
customer_reviews.author: goodbuyer

customer_reviews.title: #1 pick of professional sound engineers for 30 years
customer_reviews.text: I'm an old recording studio engineer from way back in the analog dark ages. This model headphone has been around forever. I have 3 pair and have replaced the cushions a few times. There is no comparison when it comes to comfort and accuracy. I guarantee you that more hit records have been recorded and mixed by engineers wearing these than any other pair of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: ziphler

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a few years ago and have used them sparingly. They sit mostly in a drawer until I remember I have them. I pulled them out recently and the earmuff foam is literally falling apart every time I touch them. The sound quality is good but I cannot use them anymore without having to clean pieces of foam off of my ears, the desk, etc. after each use.
customer_reviews.author: Norcalsurf

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal range of frequency response.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are impressive, for the 30 plus years that I have listened to various types of music with or without headphones, I received these on 4/25 and tried them out. Listened to the song " I want to know what love is" by Foreigner and was blown away at the frequency response especially at the lower end. To hear the lower end at what I heard you would need to have purchased a high end sub-woofer. Well, not with these headphones, worth every penny! By the way, never knew that the musical notes were even in this song.
customer_reviews.author: Sirimarn C.

customer_reviews.title: Like the Audio Technica M50x, it’s legendary.,
customer_reviews.text: I was blown over by the wide dynamic range...deep thunderous lows when the source called for it and crisp highs with perfect mid tones. I can’t believe i lived this long and never discovered this model sooner! I can see why this is a studio reference headphone. I own a Marantz Professional headset but this is way better. As a musician, I demand natural unaltered notes. This headphone although not as well built as the Audio Technica ATH- M50xBT, performs every bit as good and in the lower frequencies a little better. You will not want to take this off your head it’s THAT GOOD!
customer_reviews.author: Tom C

customer_reviews.title: The absolute best headphones on the market. Professional Quality Certified.
customer_reviews.text: By far the absolute best headphones I have ever bought. If you buy this item, you owe it to yourself to buy the hardened shell case Amazon offers with these headphones. You cannot possibly buy a better quality pair of headphones. Mine came with the original Sony certificate of professional quality along with the limited lifetime warranty all within it's original factory packaging. As a music audiophile aficionado, let me tell you that you haven't experienced your music the way the artist intended until you've heard it through these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Adrenaline Junkies Bikes

customer_reviews.title: Headphones just okay, not great, but it is very subjective.  Please read my review.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of all the great reviews. Any headphones are very subjective, but I found the highs very harsh and I found them not very balanced, lacking mids. I ended up with another pair that I liked better. Again it's subjective. The first pair I got sounded horrible. My recommendation is to try a few different headphones to test them out and choose the ones that sound best and work best for your needs. Also, my old Sony headphones were made in Japan, now they're made in Thailand, so I'm sure there are quality differences. The headphones are okay, so that is why I gave them 3 stars. I was hoping that I'd love them.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Webber

customer_reviews.title: Really good isolation and clean sound
customer_reviews.text: I needed something for the loud rainy days here during the summer. The rain used to overpower my open back headphones and couldn't hear anything. These do a great job at blocking rainfall noise letting me focus on my work and gaming. The stock pads were obviously a let down, but luckily there are memory foam ones that you can buy to make them the perfect headphone. Sound is very clean with just enough bass to rumble you ears. The highs are very detailed and appreciate that for gaming. I hear things in these headphones that my old sennhesiser sound used to mask because they had rolled off treble making everything sound like it was covered by a blanket
customer_reviews.author: Tt

customer_reviews.title: Great sound & comfort for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound great straight out of the package and are comfortable to wear for long periods. I like the over-the-ear style more than IEMs because of the greater comfortability, though they aren't as portable. Like IEMs, these create a good seal and don't allow much outside noise in. The chord is VERY long, so these are better suited to your desk than walking around; there would be a lot of extra to deal with for the latter. The 1/4-inch adapter is nice if you've got an electric instrument or amplifier that needs that.
customer_reviews.author: Sheridan M

customer_reviews.title: The only headphones I use
customer_reviews.text: When I noticed that these are an industry standard, I tried a pair, loved them for 10 years, and just bought my second pair because the 10 year old pair was accidentally damaged. It will be a sad day when you aren't able to get these anymore. Luckily they're highly serviceable so you can very cheaply repair almost any component on them. You can wear these for 4 hours and forget you even have them on. Bass response is flat because they're monitor headphones, but they have no issues producing the bass you might want with a little EQ. They can handle a lot of power as well
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Barber

customer_reviews.title: These are truly awesome headphones
customer_reviews.text: Forgive me for using the most abused word in the English language but these headphones are truly awesome. I've had them about four months but today I listened to a new Santana album, Africa Speaks, and these headphones rock around the clock. If someone handed them to me and told me they cost $300 I would not be surprised. They seem to present evenly from lows to highs. They are a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this headphone for my piano keyboard. Excellent quality for the price. - Update: I decided to switch them out for Sennheiser HD 600. For playing piano, the MDR7506 was a little tight around my ears and got warm since they are closed back. If they fit well, I do recommend the 7506's. They are a great deal for the price for provided sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC REALISM - ADD LITTLE BOOMCLOUD 360 FOR NEAR PERFECTION
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on numbers -- of buyers and reviews. 4,000. One 5 star review was detailed and professional and stated that the quality was closer to a $300.00 pair of phones. I think this is right. The sound is great and you feel like you are there in person. The one downside was a bit less dynamic bass. I corrected this by adding an inexpensive little boomcloud 360 amp and this makes it perfect --- with a choice, use it or not. After a few hours, ​these are not as comfortable as Sennheiser 414 - but the reality of being there makes it worth it. Great deal for the money.
customer_reviews.author: michaell

customer_reviews.title: They sound amazing and they are comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I am not an audiophile but I love how these headphones sound. They're sitting at my desk at work and I use them everyday. I love how you can hear every detail of the music. Way cheaper than a lot of headphones out there and it sounds really good!!!! I always recommend them to friends looking for a new pair of headphones. I think they have an incredible value for the cost. Also they are really comfortable. I can use them for several hours without any discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Rego

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, but Ear Cushions Deteriorated, but Are Replaceable
customer_reviews.text: Theses are nice, comfortable headphones. I bought them four years ago and use them only occasionally. Recently, I went to use them and found the plether of the cushions deteriorated and left black specks of plastic all over my ears and hair. This is nothing unusual because I've had many other cushions on various other headsets do the same over the years. Fortunately, Sony engineered the cushions to be removable and replaceable. I really like these earphones, and fortunately Amazon sells higher-grade replacement pads for $20 a pair. To me it's worth the extra money to get more use out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Giles Fischer

customer_reviews.title: The price is right
customer_reviews.text: These have very good sound. Listening to on my iPhone, or even my home stereo with vinyl or cds. They’re good to pick up subtleties in the recordings that you normally wouldn’t be able to hear on lesser quaility headphones or speakers. These are not the best headphones I’ve ever owned, but they are the best for the price. I would pay $80 all day for these than $200 I’ve spent on sennheiser or higher end headphones. I like the retro styling and build quality is above average.
customer_reviews.author: David Desrosiers

customer_reviews.title: These are great. Did a side-by-side comparison with my AKG K240's ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Did a side-by-side comparison with my AKG K240's and these are significantly brighter (more treble) but they don't lose any bass. They're comfy, the telephone style cord is not something I'd normally choose, but it's great and less tripping over than the AKG regular long cord. They completely enclose the ear and sit firmly in place. If you're a consumer looking for "bass that kicks" these are not for you. If you're doing pro audio work or have a home studio and want to work for extended periods on comfort, I'd say these are great.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Incredible headphones for the money!!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. The clarity is absolutley amazing!! Seriously crazy good sound. Highly recommend buying the wicked cushions ear pads too. Makes these headphones over the top comfortable!!! Also if using with a samsung note 5 you will need the fospower 3.5mm female to 3.5mm male adapter to work. The headphones come with a 3 pole (2 ring/TRS) jack. The samsung note 5 only recognizes the 4 pole (3 ring/TRRS). I tried plugging them directly in and they didn't work at all. Plugged in with adapter works awesome!! On my daighters iphone 6 it plugged straight in and worked without an adpater. Hope that info helps someone.
customer_reviews.author: Smiley

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy customer
customer_reviews.text: It’s not even close to what you see in the product description. Low quality material.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: From a radio broadcaster
customer_reviews.text: These "cans" as they're called in radio, along with the Sony MDR-V6, are the industry standard. You would be hard pressed to find people in radio without these monitors. The sound is tremendous on both products. Sony has skimped out for a number of years on providing a leather pouch for these headphones. On the MDR-7506 they provided a cheap, cloth style bag to carry these cans in. Over years of daily use, the chord will tangle so a carrying case is recommended. Great product, though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my teenage son, as he has gone through numerous pairs over the years. I've had mine for eleven years with no issues. The bag will eventually disintegrate, along with the foam ears if you own them for a while (I've replaced the foam ears with no issues). The electronics however have never failed. They do tend to sound brighter than pretty much every other pair of headphones I've used. For my professional work in classical music, they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T. Farrington

customer_reviews.title: I could almost hear an angelic choir when I opened the package
customer_reviews.text: These headphones came in a silk-lined package - I swear I could hear an angelic choir when I opened them. I was shocked and pleased to discover that they included a card with full disassembly instructions and a list of replacement parts. Audio quality isn't perceptibly different from my (also Sony) ear buds, but then I'm not really an audiophile. My main reason for buying them, however, is for recording, and the key feature is the closed back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: my favorite headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: i bought a pair of head phones twice the cost of these for music production and hated them so tried these out 5 years ago of curiosity and love them. very balanced sound - perfect for music production and listening to all kinds of music. this is my 2nd pair only because I wore the f*** out of my old pair. ive sat on them by accident dropped them numerous times. i really treated them like hell and they lasted 5 years before having any problems. the sound in the right ear went out and i immediate bought another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Da

customer_reviews.title: best headphones in is price point we think-purchased for college audio recording classes.
customer_reviews.text: Our son's audio recording class listed 3 acceptable headphones models for the class. This was the least expensive so we got it but it blew us away. My son, who spends a lot of time with headphones on said it is very clean, no excessive boost to the base and (his words) bigger on the inside, sound-wise. I just know it sounds like listening to music in a room rather than through headphones. 2.5 years now. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: A FANTASTIC PAIR OF HEADPHONES FOR AN ABSOLUTE BARGAIN!
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through many headphones and I have to say that I have found the best and perfect ones in these headphones. Sure, they're not wireless, but I couldn't care less about that detail. I didn't care too much for the blue stickers on the sides of the headphones, so I gently and carefully removed them and I think my headphones look better without the stickers. I also didn't like how the original ear cushions felt against my ears, so I replaced them with a pair of Wicked Cushions protein leather ear cushions and am a lot happier.
customer_reviews.author: David Condon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - replace the earcups, wish cord were detachable
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound & build quality. They're comfortable enough, but the plastic on the earpads gets sweaty after a while. Similar products usually start flaking off quickly. I bought a pair of replacement pads that have a soft suede feel to them and are much more comfortable. Other downside is the cord. For their nominally intended market (professionals in studios) it's probably great. And for sitting at my desk it's fine. But I'd like to use them while walking around - and for that the cord is a bit much. A detachable cord would be a big improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Pritts

customer_reviews.title: Good set of headphones
customer_reviews.text: Good headphones, and the flat response is what I expected. The cable is nice and long, and the headphones are comfortable to wear. The one thing that surprised me, and stood out for me was the volume of the headphones. This is to say that setting the volume to 50% on the source, these headphones will be louder than my Bose noise cancelling headphones, as well as the Bose earbuds. I like that I don't need to turn the volume up so much to get a comfortable volume level. I assume that this will also help to properly adjust the level of any recorded audio. So far, I'm very happy with these for the price. I would definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality and very good value
customer_reviews.text: Not an audiophile. Actually my ears are pretty numb. But I do own several pairs of the most popular headphones below $200. In my opinion, the sound of this pair is almost as good as the Audio Technica ATH M50x, a little better than the Sennheiser HD598 and far better than the Sennheiser HD518. The vocals are extremely impressive. For the price the sound quality is excellent.This pair also wears comfortably, blocks ambient sound better than the previous open back headphones. The major concern is the cable, which is long and heavy, and not replaceable.
customer_reviews.author: Vesper

customer_reviews.title: Essential for critical listening
customer_reviews.text: So I had been using my last pair of mixing/monitoring headphones since 2009. Needless to say, they were falling apart and on their last leg. I should've replaced them a long time ago. I needed to be a little budget conscious, and these are known as a standard for studio use. And I do not regret getting these at all. They have been great for critical listening and really opened up how old and pushed my other headphones were. The bag and ability to collapse these headphones are great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Powell

customer_reviews.title: Great reference headphones
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking to bust your eardrums and ruin your hearing, look elsewhere. If you want accurate sound reproduction, THIS IS IT! They are NOT noise canceling. They fit over your ears, but don't press on them (unless your ears are very large). They are lightweight - I can wear them for a couple of hours before I need to take a break. They have a very long cord, and come with a soft leatherette carry case. These are the ones the pro's use, and are likely sitting in many radio
customer_reviews.author: B.H.

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Really good wired headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand noise cancellation. Whatever that means. It blocks out other sounds pretty well when I'm listening to music. Little bit outside noise while i listen to lectures. I listen mostly to therapeutic instrumental music. It's s really good headphone. I wanted a wireless one, I got the Sony nc700 or something. Wireless but also have a wire but didn't like it as much. I love these ones. The coil wires are a bit heavy at times, but I use this during work on the laptop. I kept these. Get it, you will love it. I never thought I would buy wired headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Akbar777

customer_reviews.title: Precision integrates with brain'si equalization
customer_reviews.text: I used to frequent the recording studio. The clear location of each voice or instrument on the "soundstage" allows your brain to integrate all signals but maintain their unique space as well. So, the device isn't doing the mixing or creating a particular "sound." The signals are going in literally, as they are, and I mix them in my head. The result is that your individual "equalization "bias" determines how you will hear the sonds. Therefore, these phones are exceptional for rendering the voice on Skype or Facetime calls.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tracking vocals, voiceovers, recording in general, or general use listening.
customer_reviews.text: Classic tracking and mixing headphones in recording studios for as long as I can remember. I started my studio in 1999 and still have my first pair of these that I use for tracking. I just bought a new pair to go along with the 8 sets in the studio. You can't beet these for realistic representation of what is recorded. They also are very quiet while recording so you don't get bleed noise from the headphones making racket while musicians are tracking vocals, which is a common problem with some headphones. These are comfortable and quiet...and very affordable for a professional product.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound!
customer_reviews.text: My husband got these for my birthday. I didn't realize how much better things would sound with better headphones, but they really make a difference. I have a podcast and use these to edit it. They help me get the sound exactly right, which is very important! I can see a difference in the episodes I edited with these and the ones before. They are also very comfortable!My head is on the smaller side, and they fit well. They also have a LOT of give, and would fit on any size adult. Great headphones at a reasonable price. Can't beat the Prime delivery too!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have bought about 6 over-the-ear headphones over the last few years. I have been looking for a sound-isolating headphone (non-noise canceling) that was comfortable to wear for several hours at a time. This headphone fits my requirements and is not too expensive. I am older and do not have very good hearing above about 6 KHz, so I can not attest to the sound quality over the entire frequency range. In the range of my hearing, the headphones work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon_retired

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for journos or podcasters
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to monitor interviews and podcast recording. They sound quality is perfect for these (I don't know about for music) and because they fully cover the ears, you only hear what comes through your microphone. They're also extremely comfortable for extended periods. My 90 year old mother likes them because she can listen to podcasts without removing her hearing aids and without bothering other people.
customer_reviews.author: Osha Gray Davidson

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Headphones for the price:
customer_reviews.text: I don't know, i guess i'm just an old-school traditionalist, but i still swear by Sony for certain things. For the price, these headphones are super-high quality in sound and build, very comfortable (i can wear them for over an hour with nary an itch or pressure point), and just never fail. I wouldn't necessarily recommend them for strict studio use, but for "every day" listening through a stereo or audio streaming, you'd be hard-pressed to outdo them.
customer_reviews.author: ajbstrat

customer_reviews.title: Great product and a sound value
customer_reviews.text: Can’t go wrong with this super affordable headphones. These are great for use when you want a wide flat sound to monitor the eq and get a straight balanced output. I like that the sound seems unmolested, making it easier to tweak the levels up and down the spectrum.
customer_reviews.author: Khoaperation

customer_reviews.title: Gaming
customer_reviews.text: Use them for gaming paired with a blue yeti microphone. Excellent for gaming, would never buy a gaming headset again, sound quality is superb on these. Not extremely bassy tho if that’s your thing, but your situational awareness definitely increases with these on. They have an amazing sound stage for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan T

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good headphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on reviews from CNET, Wirecutter, etc. They are fairly detailed and airy sounding however I was somewhat disappointed in their lack of grunt or power. Being over the ear headphones I was expecting more oomph and these lack it. I have to crank up the volume to get an immersive sound and I don't normally listen at high volumes. I usually listen to classical and jazz with some occasional pop/rock. This is only my 2nd headphone purchase after some decent Shures. These Sonys don't sound that much better than my Shure which cost about 1/3.
customer_reviews.author: J. L.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the $
customer_reviews.text: I'm an audio/video professional, and for the money these are awesome. They're not quite as good as the Sony 7520's costing about 4x more, but they're a great buy for the $. I've used Sony headphones for decades in my work... they're rock solid. I can't speak to how long they'll last yet, but I'm still using another pair that's over 15 years old, so we'll see... That being said, I do feel that in many other product areas Sony has really gone downhill. And their customer service is godawful.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: The BEST!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace my 6 year olds of same model Immediately notice that Sony has improved the quality Unbelievable clarity and output The cord is like 7 feet long for studio use (they are studio monitoring headphones) I use them on my commute to work A bit awkward when off the bus walking Gotta tuck the cord in my pocket Worth it The best headphones I’ve ever heard...take that Beats
customer_reviews.author: CrimKing

customer_reviews.title: These Will Last A Long Time
customer_reviews.text: These are the classic headphones. They are comfortable and they sound great. I use them attached to my cell phone for work and they don't drain the battery nearly as quickly as I thought they would. They cord can be a little unwieldy but it sure comes in handy when you need it to reach 8 feet or more and stay plugged in. I'm not real easy on the equipment I own and these headphones have held up quite well so far. The ability to purchase spare parts is also a major plus.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary S Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Stop buying new headphones and just get these.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones two years ago and I usually go through headphones every six months. Let me just start by saying that you NEED these headphones. The audio quality can't be matched by any headphones under 300 dollars. And even then, I prefer these over the more expensive models I've owned. The bass hits smoothly, it picks up instrumental noise without overpowering vocals in any genre of music which is really important for me. Every level of sound from bass/mid/treble is balanced and crisp. Using these is like a daily treat for me and I'm left with zero desire for any other headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price. Stylish, comfortable, and sound great.
customer_reviews.text: Product was packaged nicely and sounds great! Will be spending some more time with these to get an idea on how well they perform over time. I swapped the ear pads out for some nicer ones that are perforated, which I highly recommend if you're looking to get these. So far they are very comfortable as they are fairly light and don't clamp too tightly. I have tried without a DAC to drive them and had no issues. Added a hard case for travel and it should be good to go for a long time
customer_reviews.author: H. M. Farley

customer_reviews.title: Possibly the best phones available when factoring in price
customer_reviews.text: Possibly the best phones available when factoring in price. Extremely comfortable to wear for an extended time frame. If buying for general use, some might find the low end lacking punch and fullness. This is to be expected as their response is very flat and accurate. A simple EQ is all that's needed to provide some thump. I use these mostly when recording drums and guitar but also for general listening at times. For overall music, phones such as the Audio Technica ATH 40's and 50's might be a better choice although nowhere near as comfortable as the Sony's.
customer_reviews.author: BeerGuy

customer_reviews.title: They sound really good without the bass drowning things out
customer_reviews.text: I use my headphones for music production. I had a pair of $300 Sennheisers (don't remember the model) that I loved but noticed that what I was hearing did not match the sound on my Bluetooth speakers or my car audio system. The Sony headphones still sound good and the frequencies match with my other devices.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Good

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and stable sound
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great for home use. I've been using them with my laptop to watch videos and they have excellent sound. The bass response is actually pretty medium, with the headphones being more focused on middle-range sounds. They work great for listening to music vocals and speeches; I listen to a lot of lectures, tutorials, and podcasts, and these headphones work great for them. They're also incredibly comfortable; i've actually fallen asleep with them on! Definitely a great buy if you're looking for a medium duty headset for home.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Great for studio voice monitoring, music listening is lackluster
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep this simple: I use these headphones in my podcast studio and wear them while recording. They do a great job for listening to your voice. The midrange and highs sound crisp. But I don't use them when I edit or listen to music. I find the bass and lower ranges to be weak. I like to hear the bass and that's where I find these headphones to be lackluster. Otherwise, no complaints with the padding and they're lightweight for transport.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob L Rice

customer_reviews.title: I really loved my Shure's (they lasted for about 6 years before ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had a couple of studio headphones before, most recently the Shure SRH440. I really loved my Shure's (they lasted for about 6 years before having some mechanical failures) and I think the audio had a slight edge over the Sony MDR7506, but the Sony's are much more comfortable around the ear, very soft and cushiony ear cups and head band. I can wear for long stretches at a time without any discomfort. The audio is still really good on the Sony's, crisp, with a wide range and delicate attention to stereo recordings. Plus, they're cheaper, a really good deal for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: wyguy93

customer_reviews.title: Loved these headphones in the winter, not so much in the summer
customer_reviews.text: As some other reviewers have pointed out, these headphones are extremely warm over your ears. That is exactly what you need in the Midwest (US) winters but now that summer is upon us, I find these to be quite unbearable if I wear them for longer than 10 minutes. Sound quality is excellent though. If you're willing to keep the temperature in the room lower than 72 deg Fahrenheit, these will be okay. Definitely not for outdoor use in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Styx

customer_reviews.title: New audio enthusiast. Hearing things iv'e never heard before in my favorite songs
customer_reviews.text: I'll preface this with these are one of my first "studio quality" headphones other than really bass heavy sets like Dre. Beats (ehh) and bose. DO NOT buy if your intending on only using your phone to drive these. Sound card or amp is basically required to get what I would consider as normal loudness, but once you get em there... OMG the detail and accuracy of these headphones are astounding. I personally don't have deep catalog of hi-fi monitors but I have listen to countless head phones and at double this price range I don't foresee much accuracy gained if that is what you are going for.. In my humble opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding + Industry Standard.
customer_reviews.text: Have used these & the V6 in my studio for over 20 years with Rane headphone amps and console. None that I can remember have ever failed. Never a complaint. Ear pads seal very nice and are comfortable for hours. Many drummers use them live including Nigel Olsson who's used them live for years. These are an industry standard in radio and a true work-horse. Very durable with an exception. The weak part of these is the ear pads and expect them to fail pretty quick and that's ok. Good news is that you can buy replacement's that are much better than the ones that come on these.
customer_reviews.author: DWD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for editing podcast.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for editing my podcast. Work fantastically and the level of noise cancelling is ideal for editing. Sound quality is supreme and o can pick up any small background noise with these and that’s crucial to the editing a podcast.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia S Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a working musician and I see why these headphones have been so highly touted and unchanged for decades. Big thanks to the manufacturer for not price gouging. Are they the absolute best? Probably not. Are they much better than the majority of people would ever notice or even need? Very likely, yes.
customer_reviews.author: T. Bedwell

customer_reviews.title: Very highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best headphones I've ever owned. They are lightweight and pack into a small space. They have superb sound isolation -- better than some noise-cancelling headphones I've tried -- and brilliant clarity all through the tonal range. The only downsides are that you can clearly hear the difference between MP3 quality and WAV, and the difference between mobile digital audio and a high-quality sound card. This isn't much of a pain point in my estimation as it may encourage people to choose higher quality sound sources.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good. Worth the money if on sale.
customer_reviews.text: Came a day faster than it said, nice surprise. People were right, the bass is very meh. These are nice quality headphones. I wouldn't get them if you want them for music alone though. My Logitech G230 gaming headset are honestly are better for music than these, these however are great for VA work. Very lightweight and fits well. I've seen some people complaining that they fall off, I have a pretty average head (20F) and no slip here. All in all they're a nice quality you can feel and hear. Kinda smaller than I thought they'd be. 9/10 If I could do it again I might buy different ones but no buyers remorse here.
customer_reviews.author: The goo-bler

customer_reviews.title: Very good headphones after replacing stock earpads
customer_reviews.text: I use this to listen to music from my computer. The cord is nice and long and coiled, so it doesn't get in the way but lets me move around. The sound is good. My only issue was that the ear cups weren't super comfortable. The padding is too thin, so it pressed against my ears rather than cupping my ears. I ended up getting a pair of Brainwavz Replacement Memory Foam Earpads for another $20 which made these headphones much more comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Don't spend more - you don't need to
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, solid construction, nice and easy adjustments via headband. I can't imagine how spending more can get more sound., These are amazingly accurate in all frequencies. Not overly heavy on base, it's natural. Nothing missing in the mids and highs either. You'll hear vocals as they were meant to sound. The little hidden nuances that are buried deep will come alive and thrill your inner ear !! For the money, you can not do better. I like that the 1/4" adaptor screws onto the 3mm end - this ensures a firm, tight and cohesive connection. DO IT !
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L Scalf

customer_reviews.title: High quality audio, medium build quality.
customer_reviews.text: First the good, this headset has great quality, and really dampens noise in the room. However, also for that reason ( the noise dampening is too good) it is not my favorite to use in calls or while talking as it interferes with my ability to hear myself well. So depending on your use case and preference, that is good or bad. The minus one star is to to the build quality seeming a little weak. There are narrow bits of plastic that seem like they could break easy.
customer_reviews.author: rickyh

customer_reviews.title: Crisp sounds. Bass is ok.
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are incredibly comfortable but bass on them aren't very loud. The higher pitch sounds are very crisp. Unfortunately the bass is stripped of the power it normally has (very little umf). I used this pair on my piano and the lower pitches didn't feel as dominant as they did with my old pair (a behringer hpm 1000). For my phone and computer this pair was amazing for piano use it was ok. I loved that after two hours of use my ears didn't get sore like they used to.
customer_reviews.author: Mini

customer_reviews.title: Sony magic!
customer_reviews.text: After wasting money on headphones of lesser quality, I decided to spend a significant amount more on headphones then I normally would. Sony knows a lot about audio. ( Playstation, Bravia TV’s etc..) These headphones prove it . They produce Crystal clear audio at all volume levels, the construction is solid and the materials used are high quality . I use these with my Casio LK-280 keyboard and they are super comfortable to the point where I do not think about them. With the cheaper models, I was always aware that I was using headphones. With the Sony MDR7506 I can focus on learning, not cursing !
customer_reviews.author: Athlon

customer_reviews.title: Sound is great, better than what comes out of my Polk Speakers.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I dont like is they are kind of loose fitting. Albeit the sound is great, I mean really great. I have 2 Polk 3 way speakers which are top of the line, I have a Polk midrange, Polk super bass and another Polk midrange5 feet under the first midrange, and 2 polk rear speakers mounted on the ceiling, so the sound system is very good, but the sound coming out of the sony headphones is fantastic! Highly recommend the sony but maybe I need different ear cushions?
customer_reviews.author: Raymond S. Iorio

customer_reviews.title: Good for home use
customer_reviews.text: I use this at home for (1) occasional home studio recordings, (2) listening to music for multiple hours while working. They are plugged into a pair of studio monitors when I need them, so that gives enough amplification for their high impedance. For this usecase a I do not have a single complaint: they are light enough so you can wear them for hours, your ears don't get sweaty or tired. The sound curve is flat, so good for recordings. I never take them out, so can't comment on sturdiness, but I wouldn't want to travel with them.
customer_reviews.author: Andrey Antipov

customer_reviews.title: It's hard to add to the accolades of the Sony MDR7506
customer_reviews.text: The MDR7506 is great value for money and sounds terrific. A lot of praise gets heaped upon this classic headphone for good reason. They sound accurate, are comfortable and appear to be very durable. Yes, the coiled cord is long, but it's a wired headphone and I would rather have more cord than not enough . While these are not noise-cancelling headphones, they do an OK job of isolating outside noises. I primarily use these for non-critical monitoring, and they sound great to my ears. They are very neutral/flat sounding and are therefore, not bass-boosted like most consumer headphones these days. If you're looking for outrageous mega-bass, then the MDR7506 is not going to be your cup of tea.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Irtenkauf

customer_reviews.title: Not Quite What I Expected
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have some nice features. They are very comfortable to wear, and fold to a compact enough size for travel. They seem well-made, like most Sony products. However, I am not all that impressed by the sound quality. I listen mostly to classical music, and thought these headphones are fine in the mid-ranges, the highs are a little too "bright", and the reproduction of string bass is odd. It is sort of fuzzy, with a slight echo, or with a small excess vibrato sound. I have used headsets for half the price that had equally good sound, and I have owned sets for twice the price that produced sound quality far superior to these Sony's.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald W. Arcuri

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other popular headphone brands which are weighted to give the appearance of quality, these are super lightweight and comfortable. I wear them for hours at a time and hardly notice. Good at blocking out noise in the room, and your music is hardly noticable to anyone else even at louder volumes. Personally I like the long springy cord, less likely to get stuck in your chair wheels than other kinds. The one downside is that as others have said, the material on the cushions will eventually degrade and fall apart. Such is life I suppose, better something superficial than to have them actually break.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

product_meta.title: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone
product_meta.description:
Style:HeadphonesSony MDR7506 Professional Stereo Headphones are ideal for sound monitoring in recording studios, radio, film production, video, electronic news gathering - and virtually any application where high quality sound is required. The closed-ear design MDR-7506 is outrageously popular in pro and home recording studios. It features a rugged design, convenient folding construction, 40mm driver units, gold connectors and a professional-quality OFC (oxygen free copper) cord. Sony 7500 Series headphones offer a practical range of choices for everyone from the casual user to the studio pro. These include the MDR-7506 which is lauded by many professional studios and broadcasters. Features Rugged Design: Proven to be reliable in the toughest situations Folding Construction: Compactness in storage 40mm Driver Unit: For clear, high quality sound reproduction Closed-Ear Design: Comfort and reduction of external noise interference Stereo Unimatch Plug: 1/4 inch and 1/8 inch applications Gold Connectors and OFC Cord: Reliable and stable signal connection and transmission Supplied Soft Case: Protective storage AmericanMusical is an authorized dealer of Sony products.

AMAZON.COM


The Sony MDR-7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone is a large diaphragm foldable headphone designed for professional studio and live/broadcast applications. These large diaphragm, foldable headphones feature a rugged construction, a secure, highly effective closed-ear design, and a 40 millimeter driver unit for clean, clear sound reproduction.

Designed for professional studio and live/broadcast applications. Click here for a larger image 9.8 foot cord ends in a gold 3.5mm plug; 1/4-inch adapter included. Headband with generous padding for added comfort. PROFESSIONAL SOUND
A neodymium magnet provides excellent power-handling, and 40-millimeter drivers deliver high-quality sound, with a wide frequency response of 10 Hz - 20 kHz.

Enjoy crystal-clear highs, present mids, and an extended low-end, for accurate monitoring.

COMFORT AND ISOLATION
The MDR-7506s feature a closed-ear design, which provides both comfort and outstanding reduction of external noises. Comfort is only enhanced by the generous headband padding.

A 9.8-foot coiled cord provides more than enough slack for working in a studio without removing the phones, whether you're the performer, the engineer, or both.

ACCESSORIES
The included Stereo UniMatch plug allows use in both 1/4-inch and 1/8-inch applications, and a soft case for protective storage is included with the headphones--fold them up and stow them a way safely.

MDR-7506 SPECS
Headphone Type: Dynamic, closed Magnet Type: Neodymium Driver Size: 40.0 mm Frequency Response: 10Hz - 20 kHz Impedance: 63 Ohms Sensitivity (db): 106dB/mW Power Handling Capacity: 1000mW Plug Type: Gold, Stereo Unimatch plug 1/4" and 1/8" Cord Length: 9.8 feet Weight: 8.1 oz. WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Sony MDR-7506 Headphones, 1/4-Inch Adapter, Soft Case



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Sony MDR7506 Professional Stereo Headphones are ideal for sound monitoring in recording studios, radio, film production, video, electronic news gathering - and virtually any application where high quality sound is required. The closed-ear design MDR-7506 is outrageously popular in pro and home recording studios. It features a rugged design, convenient folding construction, 40mm driver units, gold connectors and a professional-quality OFC (oxygen free copper) cord. Sony 7500 Series headphones offer a practical range of choices for everyone from the casual user to the studio pro. These include the MDR-7506 which is lauded by many professional studios and broadcasters. Features Rugged Design: Proven to be reliable in the toughest situations Folding Construction: Compactness in storage 40mm Driver Unit: For clear, high quality sound reproduction Closed-Ear Design: Comfort and reduction of external noise interference Stereo Unimatch Plug: 1/4 inch and 1/8 inch applications Gold Connectors and OFC Cord: Reliable and stable signal connection and transmission Supplied Soft Case: Protective storage AmericanMusical is an authorized dealer of Sony products.
